On Mon, Feb 02, 2004 at 01:24:59PM -0500, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> 
> Bauduin Raphael wrote:
> 
> <snip />
> > My question about the organisation of the tests is that I feel like all
> > tests are first added to the suite, and are run only after all tests
> > have been added. Am I wrong on that? 
> 
> No: you are correct. First, JUnit adds all the tests, then executes them.
> 

Would there be a way to test the customers 100 by 100, freeing the memory
each time?
I suppose I can program it myself in the main loop over the customers,
but mayber ther's a way to do it using a junit feature?

Thanks for your help

Raph

> > If it runs as I said, adding all
> > 10^6 tests to test the whole database could be the reason of an out of
> > memory problem (all objects to be tested would be in memory, which means
> > the whole db would be loaded in memory). It's just a guess, just trying
> > to understand (I could be completely wrong actually ;-)
> 
> That's definitely the problem. How to handle it... more heap size in the 
> JVM, perhaps?
> --
